title: The Relationship Between Sports Performance and Emotional Processes: Understanding Through Nonlinear Pedagogy

context.prior_knowledge: Basic concepts in sports science and introductory knowledge of psychology
context.additional_context: Learners explore emotional processes affecting sports performance and design self-directed learning experiences via nonlinear pedagogy, integrating theory and practice through real-time discussions and feedback sessions

learning_goals: Learners can explain the impact of various emotion-inducing conditions (positive/negative noise, no noise) on sports performance.
Learners can practice evaluating their own performance using self-monitoring and intrinsic feedback.
Learners can apply a framework analyzing emotion-performance associations based on ecological dynamics theory and nonlinear pedagogy.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
